Poor kitty…

My poor kitty has been in medical hell for the last couple of weeks. Apparently his pancreas imploded and his sugars and liver got all totally wacky and he spent 3 nights in the kitty prisonhospital and since then we‚Äôve been playing the dance-of-the-sugars with him where I stab his precious ear to get blood and test his sugar level. Whee. As it turns out, it might have been a transitory case of diabetes ‚Äì the insulin is putting him way too low so we‚Äôre backing him off. Yesterday I had to test his sugar 5 times. Today he does not like me at all. Or perhaps it has something to do with the Irish Hiking Scarf around his neck, although I think it makes him look very distinguished. And look! It‚Äôs almost done! Just over 4 feet now, and I‚Äôm going for 5. If only I were actually knitting it for the cat I would be done already, but I‚Äôm pretty sure he doesn‚Äôt want one. All he wants is for me to stop poking at him with sharp needles.

I‚Äôve decided to ignore the extra cable which somehow slipped in there:

It‚Äôs a‚Ä¶ um‚Ä¶ ‚Äúdesign element‚Äù (thanks to Michelle for this concept) and not a mistake.

Thank heavens, because I have forbidden myself from joining any of the new knitalongs which are starting up until this scarf is done. It‚Äôs a Christmas present and already somewhat late (duh). Plus, it‚Äôs not like I don‚Äôt have other knitting projects to do once it‚Äôs finished‚Ä¶ I have all my dishcloth yarn to knit up, my friend is expecting me to turn this Manos Cotton Stria into something more interesting (probably an Easy Lace Scarf with some striping. But oh, the Chevron scarf from Last Minute Knitted Gifts sure looks cool. Hard, but cool. Anyhow, I have to keep reminding myself‚Ä¶ I‚Äôve only been knitting for 6 weeks, there‚Äôs probably time to fit all this stuff in during my knitting life. Here‚Äôs the Stria ‚Äì it‚Äôs so wonderful.

There‚Äôs a part of me that wants a quickie knit because the IHS felt like it took me a long time. Instant Knitting Gratification, anyone?

Once I‚Äôve got the scarf knitted, I‚Äôll probably join the Ribby Cardi along, or possibly ‚ÄúKnit Your Bit‚Äù. Hey, maybe I could make the wristlets for my Cotton Stria friend out of the cotton. Or the hugs and kisses socks! I‚Äôm definitely participating in Wombs on Washington. What a cool idea ‚Äì knitting wombs to use as a political statement.

I added a ‚ÄúBe Fit‚Äù image over in the sidebar¬†¬ª¬ª> (stolen indirectly from the Green Eyed Girl. It links to my FitDay journal.
